title: Gregory Graham 2014 Wedge Block Chardonnay (Lake County)
description: Very rich in texture and lightly sweet in flavor, this wine smells citrusy and crisp but tastes full and soft. It has ripe pear and peach flavors and a lingering, honey-like finish.

title: Fleur Du Cap 2016 Bergkelder Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)
description: There's a pleasant and subtle chalky texture to this refreshing white, with aromas and flavors of white peach, underripe kiwi and orange peel. The cleanly fruited palate boasts great verve and liveliness, with tart gooseberry and lime flavors that unfold on the close. Drink now.

title: Pisoni 2012 Rebo (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)
description: Made entirely with organically farmed Rebo grapes, this easygoing red has subtle aromas of cassis and baking spice. The straightforward palate shows ripe red berry and a vanilla note framed in round tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Martha Clara 2014 Estate Reserve Riesling (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Sharp lemon-lime acidity levitates this zingy dry Riesling. It's exceptionally light bodied with tart slightly savory apple and pear flavors. The finish is moderately long, marked by a welcome touch of honey.

title: Leese-Fitch 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Not sweet or soft, this assertive dry wine has effusive herb and snap-pea aromas and flavors, bright acidity and medium body. It's a refreshing pour for a hot afternoon or evening.

title: La Cappuccina 2015  Soave
description: This opens with aromas suggesting mature yellow apple, acacia flower and a whiff of lychee. The straightforward enjoyable palate offers ripe Bartlett pear, bitter almond and a hint of mineral. Enjoy soon.

title: Olsen Private Vineyards 2015 Chenin Blanc (Paarl)
description: There is a green, raw wood character to this wine, with additional notes of green apple, strawberry hull and beeswax. The medium-weight palate offers a bitter orange-peel flavor alongside crisp apple and melon rind. Drink now.

title: Quinta da Beira 2014 Faisão Red (Dão)
description: Ripe, balanced and attractive, this red boasts fine tannins that lend subtle structure to the black plum fruit. Dense with fruitiness and acidity, it's rich enough to savor with meat. Drink now.

title: Quinta Dona Matilde 2015 Vinho Branco White (Douro)
description: This chalky-textured wine has bright, citrusy acidity to contrast its warmer tropical fruit character. Balanced and fruity, it will be ready to drink from late 2017.

title: Seven Falls 2015 GPS Jones Vineyard Viognier (Wahluke Slope)
description: Aromas of flowers, green herb, pear and peach lead to silky sleek stone-fruit flavors. There's some interesting things going on but the fruit doesn't quite seem to have fully ripened.

title: Sheldrake Point 2015 Estate Bottled Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Dusty mineral and candied orange rind lend a savory tone to pressed apple and pear in this surprisingly big-bodied off-dry Riesling. Soft tangerine acidity and a yielding red-apple fruit profile lends a broad warmth to the finish.

title: Spier 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)
description: This is a clean and bright selection, with pure notes of green melon, apple and fresh herbs. The lively palate offers lime peel and grassy tones that finish clean on the finish. It's an approachable and easy-drinking wine best enjoyed now.

title: St. Christopher 2015 Piesporter Michelsberg Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Plump, juicy yellow cherry and plum aromas on the nose contrast the taut, steely nature of this off-dry Riesling. Zesty lime and lemon acidity makes it refreshingly brisk and easy-drinking.

title: Renwood 2014 BBQ Zinfandel (California)
description: Fresh grapey, berry-like aromas and rich, ripe flavors make this medium-bodied wine easy to drink. It's smoothly textured and almost sweet, with generous fruit elements filling out the palate and persisting through the finish.

title: Vintales 2016 Sea Breeze Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)
description: This bright and well-balanced wine opens with typical aromas of gooseberry, green plum and fresh herbs, all of which carry through to the light, easygoing palate alongside additional notes of lime and grapefruit peel. It's approachable and clean, with crisp acidity and a mouthwatering finish.

title: Sylvestra 2015 Brut Nature Rosé  (Mendoza)
description: From Familia Bressia, this Brut Nature smells like a cross between a frosted doughnut and dried tropical fruits. In the mouth, this is citric in feel, with tart, almost sour flavors of orange along with the peel. A tangy citric finish ends with lingering grapefruit and orange notes.

title: Tapiz 2016 T Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Briary berry aromas come with hints of leather and animal. This feels dense, jammy and a bit gummy, while flavors of blueberry, chocolate and baked black plum finish chewy and a touch sticky.

title: Thomas George 2014 Cresta Ridge Vineyard Estate Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Sharp acidity and intense oak meet in this deeply concentrated, tropically-influenced white. Peach, apple pie, and faint pineapple flavors all figure in.

title: Three Brothers 2015 1 Degree of Riesling Medium Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: The nose on this off-dry Riesling is quite closed still but time and aeration allow fresh grapefruit and lemon notes to come through nicely. Zesty acidity is offset by softer flavors of red apple and tangerine along with savory nuances of nut and earth.

title: Buitenverwachting 2016 Beyond Sauvignon Blanc (Constantia)
description: Crisp and lively, this starts with soft scents of pink peony and thyme that add depth and interest to the citrus, pear and tropical fruit core. Medium acidity lifts the palate and carries through to the mouthwatering finish. Drink now.

title: Dark Horse 2014 Chardonnay (California)
description: This is a solid Chardonnay for a great price. It has full body and an oaky, buttery personality that will make few enemies. It's richly textured, with an almost-sweet quality to its fruit.

title: David Frost 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)
description: White and pink floral tones of clover and sweet pea waft from the glass on first nosing, with supporting tones of white pear, melon rind and green apple. Gooseberry and pineapple flavors unfold on the palate, framed by ample acidity that results in a short yet clean finish.

title: De Stefani 2014 Kreda Refosco (Veneto)
description: Made entirely with Refosco, this robust red has a shy nose that eventually reveals prune and a whiff of ground green pepper. The dense palate offers mature plum, vanilla and a hint of cocoa alongside the heat of evident alcohol and evolved tannins. Drink soon.

title: Domaine Bousquet 2016 Cameleon Made With Organically Grown Grapes Malbec (Tupungato)
description: Chewing gum, dry wood and generic berry aromas precede an honest palate with modest tannins. Slightly herbal black-fruit flavors are peppery but nonspecific. A steady but chunky finish is the final act.
designation: Cameleon Made With Organically Grown Grapes

title: Cave de Rasteau 2014 Les Peyriéres Red (Rasteau)
description: Earth and black olive notes dominate this cuvée from the Rasteau cave cooperative. It's medium in body, lighter than the other cuvées, hinting at red fruit and bright acids on the finish. Drink now–2020.

title: Chamonix 2015 Unoaked Chardonnay (Franschhoek)
description: There's a subtle smoky, flinty character on the nose of this wine, hitting the green herbs, apple, plum and lime core. Prickly acidity dances on the palate, enlivening the green fruit and fynbos tones. The finish is clean and refreshing, and the wine is best enjoyed now.

title: Château du Caillau 2014 Malbec (Cahors)
description: This is a juicy fruity wine with tannins that are already subdued by the acidity and fruit. There is a dry core just set to support the black-currant fruit. With a bright crisp aftertaste, the wine will mature quickly. Drink from 2017.

title: Bedell 2015 First Crush White (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Like many of Bedell's whites, there's a dense outer layer of smoky flint and match notes upon uncorking that obscure this wine's prettier fruit and mineral tones. With substantial aeration, this blend of Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Riesling shows its brisk lemony demeanor. Dry in style with a zippy light-footed feel, it makes a lovely aperitif or accompaniment to delicate fish courses.

title: Duorum 2015 Tons de Duorum Red (Douro)
description: The second wine from Duorum, the brand created by João Portugal Ramos and José Soares Franco in 2007, this is ripe with tannin, black fruit and juicy acidity. Drink from 2018.

title: Durbanville Hills 2016 Chenin Blanc (Durbanville)
description: There's a tropical edge to this otherwise bright and light Chenin, as a hint of pineapple graces the peach and sweet citrus core. Ample acidity keeps the palate fresh and the finish short yet clean. Drink now.
